description: Character evolution framework defining V1-V4 behavioral layers, emotional ranges, wound progression, and contextual states for authentic character development

v1_core_identity.description: Immutable personality foundation; these traits never fundamentally change

personality_axes.description: Core personality dimensions that define character essence

examples.introvert: Recharged by solitude; processes internally; small social circles
examples.extrovert: Energized by interaction; thinks aloud; broad social networks

dimensions.evolution_note: Introverts may learn social skills but won't become extroverts; extroverts may learn to enjoy quiet but won't become introverts

examples.intuitive: Pattern-recognition; gut feelings; reads between lines

dimensions.evolution_note: Core thinking style remains; may adopt complementary skills but defaults to primary mode under stress

examples.emotional: Feelings visible; empathetic; connects through emotion

dimensions.evolution_note: Emotional display preference is core; may learn regulation but natural expression remains

examples.risk_seeking: Bold; acts quickly; thrives on uncertainty

dimensions.evolution_note: Risk tolerance can shift slightly but baseline remains consistent

moral_framework.description: Fundamental ethical foundation; deeply resistant to change

types.description: Rules protect people; justice through proper channels
types.breaking_point: Only violates rules when rule itself is immoral and lives hang in balance

types.description: Results matter more than process; ends justify means if noble
types.breaking_point: Won't harm innocents even for greater good

types.description: Situational ethics; context determines right action
types.breaking_point: Won't betray core loyalties regardless of situation

types.description: Past mistakes drive current morality; proving worthiness
types.breaking_point: Can't return to old ways without complete character breakdown

corruption_rules.description: V1 moral framework can only change through catastrophic arc
requirements: Betrayal by institution character believed in
Loss of person who anchored moral identity
Multiple on-page moments of moral compromise building

fundamental_skills.description: Core competencies that define professional identity
examples: Detective with 15 years experience has investigative instincts
Former military has tactical awareness under fire
Street kid has survival skills and danger sense
fundamental_skills.rule: Cannot lose fundamental skills without trauma/injury; no sudden incompetence

v2_learned_behaviors.description: Acquired skills, habits, and coping mechanisms; evolves through sustained experience

skill_acquisition.description: New abilities learned through training, mentorship, or repeated practice

novice.performance: Shaky execution; requires focus; fails under pressure

competent.performance: Reliable in normal conditions; struggles with complexity

proficient.performance: Second nature; handles complications; teachable to others

expert.word_count: 30k+ words OR major time skip with justification
expert.performance: Intuitive mastery; adapts creatively; mentors others

examples.v2_progression: Ch 1: Can't detect magic → Ch 5: Detects obvious spells → Ch 10: Senses subtle enchantments → Ch 15: Identifies specific spell types
Ch 2: Loses every fight → Ch 6: Holds own with training → Ch 11: Wins against skilled opponents → Ch 16: Trains others
Ch 3: Witnesses clam up → Ch 7: Gets basic info → Ch 12: Reads microexpressions → Ch 17: Extracts hidden truths

coping_mechanisms.description: Emotional regulation strategies developed in response to trauma or stress

types.development: Forms after repeated exposure to violence/trauma
types.function: Separates work horror from personal life
types.failure_point: Breaks down when trauma becomes personal

types.development: Adopted from mentor or team culture
types.failure_point: Stops working when stakes too high

types.function: Constant threat assessment; hard to surprise

coping_mechanisms.evolution_rule: Can be unlearned with 15k+ words of positive counter-experiences and conscious work

examples: Always checks exits when entering room (after ambush)
Calls partner before entering dangerous location (after near-death)
habit_formation.rule: Habits form after 5+ repetitions shown on-page; breaking habits requires 10+ instances of conscious override

v3_situational_responses.description: Context-dependent behavior within character's established range; moderate flexibility

context_states.description: Different situations pull different aspects of character's palette

stress_context.description: High pressure but still functional; elevated state
behavioral_shifts: Relies more heavily on V1 core traits (analytical becomes more rigid, intuitive trusts gut more)
V2 skills remain but with slightly degraded performance
Emotional regulation weakens (stoic shows frustration, emotional becomes volatile)
V1 core traits amplified to extreme
V2 learned skills: trained responses become automatic, untrained skills inaccessible
V3 situation responses: may act outside normal behavior if survival requires
examples: By-the-book detective breaks into warehouse without warrant (partner screaming inside)
Stoic detective screams in rage when confronting partner's killer
Risk-averse detective takes suicidal chance when no other option exists

recovery_context.duration: Minimum 1 chapter; severe trauma requires 3-5 chapters
behavioral_shifts: Withdrawn; seeks solitude or trusted companion
V2 skills unreliable (shaky hands, poor focus)
V3 responses muted (emotionally flat or overwhelmed)

relationship_modulation.description: Character presents differently based on relationship dynamics

characteristics: May deploy false personas (part of V2 trained skills)

v4_emotional_states.description: Temporary emotional conditions that color all behavior; high mutability

primary_emotions.description: Core emotional experiences that drive behavior in the moment

behavioral_impact: Intuitive: gut screams warnings, may flee
emotions.physical_markers: Elevated heart rate, sweating, shallow breathing, hypervigilance
emotions.duration: Minutes to hours; lingers as anxiety if unresolved

behavioral_impact: Stoic: cold fury, controlled lashing out
All types: reduced impulse control, tunnel vision on target
emotions.physical_markers: Tension, raised voice, aggressive posture, flushed face
emotions.duration: Minutes to days depending on trigger severity

behavioral_impact: All types: motivation reduced, focus impaired
Can't sustain high performance; needs time to process
emotions.physical_markers: Fatigue, tears, loss of appetite, sleep disruption
emotions.duration: Days to weeks for major loss; ongoing background ache

behavioral_impact: Willingness to take risks for their safety
Vulnerability: loved one becomes leverage point
emotions.physical_markers: Relaxed around person, seeks proximity, softened expression

behavioral_impact: Reckless behavior (proving worth or seeking punishment)
Impacts decision-making: may refuse similar choices
emotions.physical_markers: Avoids eye contact, slumped posture, self-criticism
emotions.duration: Days to weeks without resolution; can become chronic

compound_states.description: Multiple emotions creating complex behavioral patterns

examples.behavior: Aggressive interrogation fueled by fear of loss; may cross ethical lines
Obsessive case focus; ignores self-care; pushes away support
Hyperprotective; may make poor tactical choices to ensure safety

physical_impacts.description: Bodily states that affect emotional stability and performance

factors.impact: Emotional regulation degrades; irritability increases; V2 skills decline 20%
Focus divided; pain creates background stress; may trigger fear response
Mood dysregulation; poor decision-making; reduced physical performance
Physical weakness + emotional volatility; compare to severe illness

emotional_momentum.description: Emotions don't reset instantly; they have realistic duration and fade patterns

rules.description: Peak intensity lasts minutes to hours; character can't maintain heightened state indefinitely
After peak passes, lingering effects remain (irritability after anger, fatigue after fear)
Cannot go from devastated to cheerful within a scene unless using unhealthy compartmentalization (V2 coping mechanism)
Multiple V4 states compound; character operating under grief + fear + exhaustion degrades rapidly

wound_progression.description: Psychological injuries that affect character across all palette levels

wound_types.origin: Betrayed by authority figure, partner, or institution
wound_types.v2_impact: Forms 'trust slowly' coping mechanism; requires proof of reliability
wound_types.v3_impact: Guarded in professional contexts; slow to open up personally
wound_types.v4_impact: Triggered by situations resembling betrayal; anxiety spikes
wound_types.healing_path: 15k+ words of consistent trustworthy behavior from new relationship; gradual risk-taking

wound_types.origin: Failed to prevent death or serious harm
wound_types.v1_impact: May question moral framework if failure violated core belief
wound_types.v2_impact: Develops hypervigilance; overworks to prevent repeat
wound_types.v3_impact: Avoids similar situations; may freeze when triggered
wound_types.v4_impact: Guilt resurfaces in similar cases; affects decision-making
wound_types.healing_path: Successful save in similar situation + processing guilt with trusted person

wound_types.origin: Lost parent/partner/mentor through death or leaving
wound_types.v1_impact: None (but informs baseline personality if childhood wound)
wound_types.v2_impact: Keeps people at distance; sabotages intimacy
wound_types.v3_impact: Pushes people away when closeness increases
wound_types.healing_path: Partner stays despite push-away; proves abandonment won't repeat

wound_types.origin: Experienced situation where competence didn't matter; overwhelmed by force
wound_types.v3_impact: Aggressive assertion of control in work contexts
wound_types.v4_impact: Panic when facing similar powerless situation
wound_types.healing_path: Accepting help; trusting partner's competence; learning limits aren't failure

wound_activation.description: Wounds are activated by situational triggers, not constantly present
wound_activation.baseline: Character functions normally; wound is background element
wound_activation.triggered: Situation resembles original wounding event; wound impacts behavior
wound_activation.rule: Don't overuse wound triggers; 1-2 times per 25k words maintains realism

integration_rules.description: How all four palette levels interact during character action

decision_hierarchy.function: Sets boundaries for possible actions; character won't violate V1 without catastrophic arc
Colors how character experiences situation and urgency of response
Determines which behavioral range within V1 is appropriate
Provides tools and skills to execute decision within constraints

example_integration.scenario: Detective's partner taken hostage by killer
example_integration.v1_decision: Will attempt rescue (loyalty is core trait)
example_integration.v4_emotion: Fear + anger creates urgency; reduces caution
example_integration.v3_context: Extreme context allows behavior outside normal range (may break rules)
example_integration.v2_execution: Uses trained tactical skills + learned magical abilities to attempt rescue
example_integration.result: By-the-book detective (V1 lawful) breaks into building without warrant (V3 extreme context justified by V4 fear for partner) using trained entry techniques (V2 skills)

agent_integration.dr_viktor: Primary validator for palette consistency; ensures V1 never violated, V2 evolution properly paced, V3 context appropriate, V4 emotions realistic
agent_integration.bailey: References palette during drafting; character decisions stay within established range
agent_integration.tessa: Validates palette consistency across chapters; tracks V2 skill progression
agent_integration.miranda: Oversees character arcs; ensures palette evolution aligns with story events

tracked_values.threshold: 100% of context shifts justified by situation
